1.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

2.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be (causatively, do or declare) wrong; by implication, to disturb, violate

properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend

3.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship

properly, to carve, i.e. fabricate or fashion; hence (in a bad sense) to worry, pain or anger
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

to flow forth (literally or figuratively); by implication, to liquify
to shrink, i.e. thicken (as unracked wine, curdled milk, clouded sky, frozen water)

11.brief: skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
a thong (as compressing); by analogy, a tendon
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

the heart (as the most interior organ);

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated

15.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to be (causatively, do or declare) wrong; by implication, to disturb, violate
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
satiated (in a pleasant or disagreeable sense)

to lie alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to catch an animal (figuratively, men); to victual (for a journey)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful

17.brief: to be new; causatively, to rebuild
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

18.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
